concept-wr.title: Stacks
concept-wr.shortdesc: A collection of resources created and managed using the Heat orchestration service is called a stack.

conbody.p: Stack resources can be flavors, images, instances, tenant networks, volumes, security groups, users, floating IP addresses, or any other entities defined and configured in Heat templates. Most types of resources offered by OpenStack can be defined in Heat templates and included in stacks.
Using the CLI, you can obtain information on existing stacks in several ways:

li.p: heat stack-list shows the names of stacks
heat stack-show name shows details about the named stack
heat stack-create name creates the named stack with given parameters
heat stack-modify name modifies the named stack according to given parameters
heat stack-delete name deletes the named stack

conbody.p: Stacks can include static and autoscaling resources.

dd.p: A resource that is defined when the stack is launched, and does not change unless a heat stack-modify command is issued.

A resource that can be created, modified, or removed in response to performance metrics collected by Ceilometer. These can include metrics generated by the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade or OpenStack platform, and metrics generated by VM instances using CloudWatch.
